abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton, in her quest for presidency in 2016, is eschewing nationwide electoral strategy that garnered Bill Clinton two terms, and instead is focusing more on gathering supporters in Great Lakes states and in parts of West and South than on cajoling undecided voters; her aides say it is only way to win amid rising polarization, when shrinking group of voters is truly up for grabs.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Clinton appears to be dispensing with the nationwide strategy that won her husband two terms in the White House, opting instead to retrace Barack Obama’s narrower path.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Traces Friendly Path, Troubling Party
headline.print_headline: Clinton Traces Friendly Path, Troubling Party

snippet: Ms. Clinton appears to be dispensing with the nationwide strategy that won her husband two terms in the White House, opting instead to retrace Barack Obama’s narrower path....
